title: I-635 Dallas photos
text: 2021 status: The photos in north and northeast Dallas between IH-35E Stemmons Freeway and IH-30 are obsolete with construction of the LBJ Express expansion, which completed in 2015, and the LBJ East project, scheduled for completion in late 2024. The photos are retained to show the original LBJ Freeway.

images.caption: Sign on Preston at LBJ
LBJ Street sign in Farmers Branch, which is between I-35E and the Dallas North Tollway.
Signs at Preston on November 15, 2008.

Drilling rigs were visible at the far western end of I-635 in 2007. This rig is at the southeast corner of I-635 and TX 121, with I-635 to the left of this image. These wells apparently found much less natural gas than the drilling firm was hoping for.

The western section of I-635, from TX 121 to I-35E, is the most recently built section (completed 1979-1981) and has the best design standards. The corridor is so wide that it is difficult to photograph. This view looks west from Olympus.
This view looks west along the westbound frontage road just west of MacArthur.
Looking west from the MacArthur overpass.

This view shows the original freeway east of Web Chapel, looking west. This is the first section of LBJ Freeway to be built, opening in 1967. After completion of the LBJ Express project in 2015, there are now three tolled lanes in a partially covered trench in the middle of the freeway.

imageStatus.note: The freeway was expanded and reconfigured by the LBJ Express project, completed in 2015.

images.caption: This view shows the original freeway looking west from the Marsh Road overpass.

imageStatus.note: The freeway was expanded and reconfigured by the LBJ Express project, completed in 2015.

images.caption: This view shows the original freeway looking east from Welch, which is just west of the Dallas North Tollway just ahead.

imageStatus.note: The freeway was expanded and reconfigured by the LBJ Express project, completed in 2015.

images.caption: This view shows the original freeway looking east at Montfort. Valley View Mall is on the left.

imageStatus.note: The freeway was expanded and reconfigured by the LBJ Express project, completed in 2015.

images.caption: This view shows the original freeway looking east from the Preston Road overpass. The High Five interchange at US 75 is visible in the distance.

imageStatus.note: The freeway was expanded and reconfigured by the LBJ Express project, completed in 2015.

images.caption: Looking east from the Coit Road overpass. This is the High Five interchange at US 75.
Looking east along the eastbound frontage road at Coit. The frontage road penetrates through the interchange. I-635 is on the third level of the five-level interchange.
This is on the east side of the High Five, looking toward the west

Looking west from the Greenville Ave. overpass. The exit ramp to US 75 just ahead is the longest ramp in the interchange at 1.4 miles. At the time of the photo, construction on the HOV lane was in progress.

imageStatus.note: The freeway is being rebuilt and reconfigured with the LBJ East project, scheduled for completion in late 2024.

images.caption: Looking southeast at Forest Lane, showing the new HOV lanes which opened (US 75 to I-30) on January 28, 2008.

imageStatus.note: The freeway is being rebuilt and reconfigured with the LBJ East project, scheduled for completion in late 2024.

images.caption: Looking northeast at Audelia with the center HOV lanes under construction.

imageStatus.note: The freeway is being rebuilt and reconfigured with the LBJ East project, scheduled for completion in late 2024.

images.caption: Looking northwest at Miller, with the DART light rail crossing ahead.

imageStatus.note: The freeway is being rebuilt and reconfigured with the LBJ East project, scheduled for completion in late 2024.

images.caption: Looking north at I-30.

imageStatus.note: The interchange is being fully rebuilt with the LBJ East project, scheduled for completion in late 2024.

images.caption: Looking south at the US 80 interchange. The design of this interchange is very similar to the I-30 interchange.
Looking north from Gross Road toward the US 80 interchange ahead.
Looking north at New Market.
Looking south just north of Elam. The end of I-635 at I-20 is just ahead.
